intro: Senecio calingastensis, commonly known as the Calingasta groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically found in Argentina. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, exhibiting succulent leaves that help it retain moisture. Its yellow flowers bloom in the spring and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
